reviews.review_msg: worst prof ever dont take this class with him hes such an unfair marker his exam questions are things we didnt even cover and they are so specific and attendance counts but all he does is repeat his slides the whole time

Dr Blaber is a great prof, bpk 140 as my elective was an easy class (as a business kid) and he cares alot about what he teaches. Not sure why he gets so much stick on rate my prof, I would take a class from him again.

If you took Bio12 this course is super easy, discussions are marked by the TA and it is easy to get a good mark. He does quizzes in his lectures so you do have to attend, and quizzes were online and pretty easy. He's a good prof and tries to make lectures interesting, I would recommend for breadth requirements.

Dr. Blaber is kind, and extremely knowledgeable, but his course was very poorly designed and way too much work for a 100 level course. So many weekly assignments including difficult discussions, and very unclear and poorly written quizzes with info mentioned only once out of 60 pages of reading and NOT on the slides; unable to reach out of class.

As a business student, I enjoyed his class. It was interesting material but he was a bit dry. Testing is fair and no curveballs. Study the material and you can get a good mark. Hes pretty  fair with his assignments and tests and doesnt pile on the work unnecessarily. No group projects which is a bonus.
First-level course with very high amount of content, quite difficult quizzes and tests. Don't take BPK 140 with him as an elective.

Take this course online if you want the best grade possible, the midterm was fairly easy, the final was somewhat tougher but worth 36% of your mark, tons of tough quizes for a first year course, TA(Meihui) had horrible English and was really difficult to understand, she also graded written answers very harshly, I worked so hard just to get a B...

We had weekly quizzes in the lecture+tutorial, and the tutorial quizzes (made by the TA) often had failing averages. Although they're not worth much, it adds up. Besides the quizzes, a lot of the tasks worth marks are easy. The midterm seemed easier than the final, but they were mostly fair. Attendance matters because you need a code for quizzes.

Dr. Blaber was an alright prof at best. His lectures were somewhat interesting at times. I found him quite difficult to reach, as he doesn't respond to emails/Canvas messages even after multiple follow-ups, and the TA's are hit or miss. Marking was tough and a bit unfair.

mainly exams are based off of lec. quizzes are off text. Proff Blaber is truly a good person and good proff. however, the ta is what makes this class (bpk 140) a pain. Meuheu marks way too harsh and is sometimes inconsiderate. but, she is open to discussion but that is a 50/50 chance of a grade change

Assigns a lot of readings but they are straightforward and he summarizes them in the lectures, which are entertaining. Professor Blaber is kind, but the TA is rude and unhelpful. His exam questions are not difficult but they were marked harshly by the TA.

Your grade is based of a large amount of small assignments so having one bad day won't ruin your ability to get a good grade. In the tutorials you are given hints about future assignments. Professor Blaber is kind and wants his students to do well.

Overall Dr. Blazer is a rather boring professor despite his best efforts. The class has alot of material and reading which can make it overwhelming. The midterm was graded quite harshly but grading was fair overall. Dr. Blaber was quite kind and responsive the few times I reached out to him.
He is a very solid professor. Most important thing in this class is to study for pop quizzes and take notes of the lecture slides.

Make sure you study for the weekly quizzes they're easy if you study for them. Don't need to attend lecture, but keep up with the course material. Assignments are pretty easy. There is a lot of the info but so much of it is common knowledge, definitely some interesting material as well. The grading was a bit tough for the short answers on exams.

While some of the comments below are true, such as heavy reading, difficult for a level 100 course, Professor Blaber is really quite considerate. Reading the textbook as well as the required weekly readings are SUPER important, even for weekly quizzes and finals. However, I did not mind the 8:30am lectures, as he actually made it interesting.
This guy is stronger then melatonin.

Wow, way to make an interesting class so dry and hard. Never have I hated a class so much. Literally so much wrong with the layout of his class, I thought I'd give it a try as it was the only class to fit with my schedule. JUST DONT!!!

This is a 100 level course but the way he made it looked like it was a 4 credit course. There are so many reading, weekly quizzes, 4 of 500 word discussion, weekly assignments and his exam doesn't only test on lecture material, he also tests on the textbook, the assignments and the articles provided. This was such a waste of time.

Dr. Blaber's exams are fairly straightforward, just read the questions carefully. Also, study the weekly topics using the textbook, and memorize key definitions. The TAs mark your assignments, which weren't too difficult.

He does not give enough time during exams to actually finish the questions. It was not necessary a hard class, but he was not a good teacher. He made things unnecessarily confusing and would do stuff to, I SWEAR, mess up students when they were taking tests/doing assignments. the whole structure of his course was also super confusing.
